title: Sri Lankan President To Seek Mandate For Lasting Peace
full text:
(RTTNews) - Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa Tuesday said that he would seek a mandate on the issue of lasting peace and development in the Island nation after his government succeeded in uprooting terrorism that had been an obstacle to country' progress.
"We had sought the mandate to unite this country and now seeking peoples mandate to create lasting peace and development," he said, adding that the Government succeeded in liberating the motherland from terrorism.
Rajapaksa, who is seeking a fresh mandate two years ahead of his first term in office which is due to end in 2011, said the decision (to go for early polls) was governed by the people's will during the ruling Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) annual convention last week.
He said the Government succeeded in implementing a major portion of the developmental work vested in it for six years, within four years and now wants to take the country along a new direction.
"We will seek the mandate of the public to create a country that can compete with the rest of the world," he said.
Later talking to reporters, a senior UFPA leader and cabinet minister Susil Premajayantha said the election commissioner has been notified of a presidential election and accordingly the dates for the nomination and those for the elections will be declared.
